comment._content: Marshall was Governor of Indiana, but now is newly elected V.P. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_R._Marshall

comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Two days before the inauguration. Apparently Marshall arrived in town before Wilson.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Photo taken on Sunday, March 2, 1913, outside the church attended by Indiana Governor Thomas Riley Marshall and his wife Lois, in Washington, D. C. Marshall, the Vice President Elect, arrived in Washington before the March 4 Inauguration Day, accompanied by an honor guard of 60 black horse troop cadets from Indiana's Culver Military Academy.
